blocks.text: To establish a general rule for determining the depth of the Centre of pressure of a section below the W.S.L. (water surface level).

Suppose the plate (representing a section) is placed as shown in Fig. 127. 

Let: 

$h = $ distance of the C.G. of the section from OY, 

$y = $ distance of the centre of pressure from OY, 

and let $h$ and $y$ be the corresponding vertical distances. 

Let $k = $ swing radius about OY, 

$w = $ weight of 1 ft. of water.

blocks.caption: Centre of Pressure

blocks.text: Now to find the position of the C.G., take moments about OY.

The moment due to the pressure on the elements 

= $p_a 	imes b 	imes  rac{1}{2} h^2$.
